intro: Baloghia balansae, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in coastal areas and disturbed habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and parks in warmer climates.
